turn.2: Finally, Miller's short, "The Studio Specter", is set in L.A., soon after the events of "Horror in Clay", and tells the story of a Phantom-like villain terrorizing a film studio.
turn.3: Did this series win any awards?
turn.4: "Horror in Clay", the cover art by Mike Fyles, and Jay Piscopo's interior artwork from this volume were nominated for 2009 Pulp Factory Awards.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Green Lama's first full-length novel in nearly 70 years, "Green Lama: Unbound", was released July 28, 2010.
turn.8: Written by Adam L. Garcia, it displayed interior and cover art by Mike Fyles.
turn.9: What time period does it take place in?
turn.10: The novel takes place roughly six months after "Studio Specter" and shortly after the last original pulp story, "Beardless Corpse.
turn.11: Did anything happen in the novel?
turn.12: " Continuing the Jade Tablet storyline established in "Shiva Enangered" and "Horror in Clay," "Unbound" pitted the Green Lama against Lovecraft's Great Old Ones and Cthulhu, as well as featured—for the first time ever—details of Dumont's ten years in Tibet.
